subject: Law
title: The Americans with Disabilities Act
description: A quick win: understand The Americans with Disabilities Act.

hook.text: A wheelchair user couldn't enter a courthouse because there was no ramp. The ADA made that illegal.

buildup.text: The ADA (1990) prohibits discrimination against people with disabilities in employment, services, and public spaces.

discovery.text: It requires reasonable accommodations: ramps, screen readers, sign language interpreters, flexible schedules.

twist.text: Compliance isn't perfect. Many websites and buildings remain inaccessible, and enforcement relies on lawsuits.

climax.text: The ADA reshaped American infrastructure and became a model for disability rights legislation worldwide.

punchline.text: Access isn't a favor. It's a right. The ADA made that clear.

quiz.question: What does the ADA require from employers?
options: Reasonable accommodations for employees with disabilities
